Objective: Describe the fundamental components of a modern operating system
Articulate process creation and destruction
Use system library code
Use system documentation
Apply computer science theory and software development fundamentals to produce computing-based solutions. **(ABET Outcome 6)**
Use simple shell scripts and system tools to analyze process behavior
Describe the fundamental (core) abstractions used to implement Operating Systems
Demonstrate how low level memory is managed in user space
Explore the system call interface
Show an understanding of the difference between user and kernel space
Articulate common problems arising in Operating System design and implementation
Construct applications that utilize processes, threads, and synchronization primitives to solve problems requiring concurrent or parallel computation
Analyze a complex computing problem and apply principles of computing and other relevant disciplines to identify solutions. **(ABET Outcome 1)**
Explore the effects of multiple threads operating on the same buffer
Identify the sources of deadlocks, race conditions, memory stomps and data loss
Apply concurrent programming techniques such as threads, event loops, and inter-process communication
Practice secure programming techniques
Produce code that is free of all memory leaks
Produce code without any out of bounds read/write errors
Identify common attack vectors with respect to the operating system
Identify common programming constructs that cause security vulnerabilities
Use professional software engineering tools and techniques.
Use a cross platform build system (win32, posix)
Use a professional unit test framework  (win32, posix)
Use a professional version control system (git)
Explore compiling and running code on at least 2 different systems
Explore how to setup a continuous integration and testing project
